summary:
And suddenly we have this young actress [who we don’t really know,” said Gilroy. I see that in some of the other characters, and I think that’s the one I don’t want.”

Elizabeth Dulau as Kleya in ‘Andor’ Season 2 ©Disney+/Courtesy Everett Collection

The ultimate Episode 210 storyline, and the incorporation of Kleya, as an almost adopted daughter, into Luthen’s backstory, was motivated and inspired by the talents of Dulau. I mean, she’s just astonishing.”

To hear Tony Gilroy’s full interview, subscribe to the Filmmaker Toolkit podcast on Apple, Spotify, or your favorite podcast platform. Gilroy and Skarsgård had both been impressed by the previously unknown actress’s talents, and wanted to give her and the character the opportunity to spread their wings before saying goodbye. But really, in the end, this is the beginning of ‘A New Hope.’ What’s going to come out of this is the phoenix of the Rebellion.”

Diego Luna and Alan Tudyk (as K-2SO) in ‘Rogue One’ ©Walt Disney Co./courtesy Everett / Everett Collection

The last three-episode cycle “Andor” also saw K-2SO (voiced by Alan Tudyk) back into the fold, returning to the prominent supporting role that the modified KX-series security droid plays in “Rogue One.” It’s a move Gilroy purposefully delayed and left to the series end.
